Package uk.pallas.systems.typr.entities.v1.validation.multi

Interface RuleWrapper

All Known Subinterfaces:
CountryCodeRuleWrapper
public interface RuleWrapper
The idea of a rule wrapper is to allow us to hold different rules for a field definition, for example postal code is different within each country (e.g. UK Post Code, USA Zip Code, etc..). Similary some things are a construction of other fields (e.g. Hostname will often have a Top Level Domain name included). The wrapper is a base interface for these different combinations to extend.

  • Method Details

    • isValid

      boolean isValid(Object toTest)
      Is the supplied test object something that matches against our field definition regular expression? If validation optional is set to true this will return true, if the supplied object is null, this will always return false. Otherwise this will call toString and then match the field definition regex tp confirm the object matches our desired value.
      Parameters:
      toTest - to test is valid
      Returns:
      false if the object fails the validation match.

    • getRule

      ValidationRule getRule()
      Retrieves the rule of the field definition e.g. post code, uk mobile, IPv4 Address, etc..
      Returns:
      non null value (if field definition is valid).

    • setRule

      void setRule(ValidationRule rule)
      Sets the validation for the field definition e.g. Post Code, Ipv6, Mobile Country Code, etc...
      Parameters:
      rule - the rules to add to our field definition
